alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Page; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 4:16PM CST until December 15 at 5:15PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CST FOR EASTERN FREMONT...MONTGOMERY...EASTERN MILLS...EASTERN POTTAWATTAMIE...SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON...SHELBY AND PAGE COUNTIES... At 415 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fort Calhoun to 8 miles northeast of Union to near Humboldt, moving northeast at 85 mph. THESE ARE VERY DESTRUCTIVE STORMS. HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. Locations impacted include... Red Oak, Clarinda, Shenandoah, Harlan, Oakland, Avoca, Villisca, Carson, Essex, Walnut, Stanton, Shelby, Minden, Farragut, Emerson, Earling, Elliott, Irwin, Defiance and Macedonia. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for southwestern Iowa. This is an EXTREMELY DANGEROUS SITUATION with tornado like wind speeds expected. Mobile homes and high profile vehicles are especially susceptible to winds of this magnitude and may be overturned. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms have the potential to cause serious injury and significant property damage.
